title: Academic Growth in Rural Schools: A Special Edition of PRiME’s Growth Reports
description:
When we talk about how students are doing in subjects like reading and 
math, it’s more helpful to look at how much they grow over time rather than 
just where they stand at one moment. This report continues the PRiME 
Center’s efforts to highlight Missouri’s excellent schools by examining 
student growth in the state's most rural schools over the last three years.

title: Reflections from a Charter School Trailblazer: Collin Hitt and Kelly Garrett sit down to discuss Garrett’s 14 years of leadership at KIPP St. Louis
description:
Reflections from a Charter School Trailblazer: Collin Hitt and Kelly 
Garrett sit down to discuss Garrett’s 14 years of leadership at KIPP St. 
Louis

title: PRiME In the News: PRiME’s Dr. Courtney Vahle discusses Missouri absenteeism
description:
In April, PRiME’s Director of Operations, Dr. Courtney Vahle, sat down with 
KOMU 8 and Fox23 NOW to discuss chronic absenteeism and her corresponding 
co-authored report, Empty Desks: An Analysis of Chronic Absenteeism in 
Missouri Schools (co-authored with PRiME affiliate researcher, Dr. Margaret 
Powers).

title: PRiME In the News: Collin Hitt on Homeschooling in Missouri
description:
This report, focused on homeschooling in Missouri, found through 
estimations that of the over one million school-aged children in Missouri, 
61,000 (6% of all school-age children) are homeschooled.
